title: Rerun 5 missing LoCoBench SG_base tasks
close_reason: All 5 tasks completed successfully. Rewards: 0.564, 0.462, 0.471, 0.542, 0.465. LoCoBench SG_base now 25/25, mean=0.511.

title: Investigate Deep Search non-adoption in SG_full
description: Only 1/129 SG_full tasks actually invoked Deep Search despite preamble documenting async workflow with retry instructions. Agent overwhelmingly prefers synchronous keyword_search (84%) and read_file (55%). Possible causes: (1) async polling UX is poor, (2) synchronous tools are sufficient, (3) preamble instructions are not compelling enough. Consider: deeper preamble emphasis, forced DS for certain task types, or accept that sync tools are sufficient.
close_reason: Investigation complete. Root causes: (1) async UX friction — 50-120s polling vs <1s sync tools, (2) sync tools cover 95%+ of needs, (3) preamble mentions DS but doesn't mandate it. Recommendation: accept low adoption as rational agent behavior; DS value is marginal when keyword_search/read_file/find_references work immediately. The retry instructions already added to preamble (lines 552-556) are sufficient — forcing DS adoption artificially would bias results. If DS-specific measurement needed, use existing deepsearch/deepsearch_hybrid modes.

title: Fill DIBench SG_base gap (4 tasks)
description: DIBench has only 4/8 SG_base tasks. Run dibench_3config.sh --base-only. Low priority since dependency install tasks don't benefit much from code search.

title: Fix doubled github.com prefix in agent CLAUDE.md template
description: claude_baseline_agent.py line ~1210 generates repo:^github.com/{repo_display} but repo_display already starts with github.com/sg-benchmarks/..., creating github.com/github.com/ which breaks ALL SG keyword searches. Affects all SG_base runs. Fix: strip github.com/ prefix from repo_display before template insertion, or remove prefix from template. All SG_base results for benchmarks using sg-benchmarks mirrors are compromised by this bug.
close_reason: Fixed in _get_repo_display(): strips github.com/ prefix from SOURCEGRAPH_REPO_NAME before returning, preventing doubled prefix in templates

notes: CORRECTED: 8 of 10 stale batches were restored from archive because they contained unique task results not present in newer batches. Only 3 batches correctly archived: pytorch_gapfill broken-verifier, linuxflbench incomplete run. The 8 restored: bigcode(2), k8s_docs(2), swebenchpro(2), sweperf(1), tac(1).

title: Reclassify context window errors in TAC and CrossRepo
description: QA audit C6: 5 context window errors misclassified as task failures (TAC find-in-codebase tasks, CrossRepo). The context_window_exceeded fingerprint exists in status_fingerprints.py but historical runs need reclassification in MANIFEST. May need to mark these tasks as infra-limited rather than agent-failed.
close_reason: Investigation found NO context window exceeded errors in TAC or CrossRepo. Original C6 audit finding was misidentified. TAC find-in-codebase failures are RocketChat network unreachable (infra issue). CrossRepo failures are genuine task difficulty (0% solve rate). High token counts reflect heavy context usage, not window overflow.

title: Fix CrossRepo verifier: COPY expected_changes.json into Docker image
description: CrossRepo test.sh references /tests/expected_changes.json but the Dockerfile never COPYs it into the image. All 4 tasks fail even when agent succeeds. Fix: add COPY tests/expected_changes.json /tests/ to each CrossRepo Dockerfile. Affects: api_upgrade_01, bug_localization_01, cross_file_reasoning_01, refactor_rename_01.
close_reason: Already fixed: test.sh path corrected from /task/tests/ to /tests/ in commit 0483b714. Harbor uploads tests/ to /tests/ correctly. Old runs used wrong path. Need reruns, not code changes.

title: Fix TAC verifier: test.sh score/final_score key mismatch
description: TAC test.sh checks for 'score' key first, but some evaluators write 'final_score'. The fallback logic exists but RocketChat tasks (tac-troubleshoot-dev-setup) also fail because RocketChat service is unreachable in Docker. Fix: verify evaluator output key consistency across all 8 TAC tasks. Root causes: (1) score key mismatch, (2) RocketChat unreachable, (3) arg mismatch in older runs, (4) find-in-codebase tasks hit context window limits.
close_reason: Already fixed: all 8 TAC test.sh files now handle both score/final_score keys AND use correct --result_path arg (not --output_path). Old runs used --output_path which eval.py rejects. find-in-codebase-1/2 fail due to network unreachable (RocketChat infra issue, not verifier bug). Need reruns, not code changes.

title: Remove API key check from check_infra.py
close_reason: Removed ANTHROPIC_API_KEY check from check_env_local, updated to subscription-only messaging

title: Design ccb_investigation benchmark suite — cross-repo tasks that exercise SG-unique tools
description: Create a new benchmark suite (ccb_investigation) with 8-12 tasks that specifically require SG tools with NO local equivalent. Categories: (1) Regression Hunt — use commit_search/diff_search/compare_revisions to find which commit broke X, (2) Impact Analysis — use find_references cross-repo to assess what breaks if we change Y, (3) API Contract Discovery — use multi-repo keyword_search to find all consumers of an API, (4) Migration Audit — find all usages of deprecated API across org. Use existing SG-indexed repos (sg-benchmarks mirrors). This is the highest-value experiment because the SG advantage is structural — local tools literally cannot do cross-repo search or commit archaeology at the same level.
close_reason: Design document completed at docs/ccb_investigation_design.md with 4 prototype tasks: regression hunt (Grafana v38 migration bug), impact analysis (K8s DRA AllocationMode), cross-service debug (Prometheus remote-write resharding), migration audit (Django ADMINS/MANAGERS format). All scenarios verified against real commits with precise ground truth from actual diffs.

close_reason: Added time_limit_sec=600 to sgt-008 and sgt-025 task.toml files

title: Epic: Design experiments to realistically demonstrate MCP code search value
description: The current benchmark mounts full repos at /workspace/, making SG tools redundant (0.001 avg delta across 70 tasks). Need new experiment designs where SG tools provide genuine, measurable value. Three tiers: (1) Cross-repo investigation tasks exercising SG-unique capabilities, (2) Mono-repo package isolation removing full-repo local access, (3) Blind-bug task variants requiring discovery. This is the project's core mission.
close_reason: All 3 design experiments completed: (1) sourcegraph_isolated — docs/DESIGN_sourcegraph_isolated.md, (2) blind-bug variants — docs/DESIGN_blind_bug_variants.md, (3) investigation tasks already run and analyzed (a06). Implementation is next phase.

title: Design mono-repo package isolation config (sourcegraph_isolated)
description: For K8s Docs and LargeRepo suites, create a sourcegraph_isolated config variant: (1) Dockerfile mounts ONLY the target package, not the full repo. E.g., for K8s applyconfig-doc-001, mount only staging/src/k8s.io/applyconfig/ at /workspace/. (2) Build/test deps installed globally. Agent can build/test within the package. (3) SG required for cross-package context — agent must use keyword_search/find_references to understand imports, callers, patterns in sibling packages. (4) Measures SG value in realistic monorepo developer workflow. Implementation: new Dockerfile per task, new agent mode sourcegraph_isolated in claude_baseline_agent.py, new config script. Start with 2-3 K8s tasks as proof-of-concept.
close_reason: Design complete: docs/DESIGN_sourcegraph_isolated.md. Phase 1: 5 K8s Docs tasks with git sparse-checkout Dockerfiles. New sourcegraph_isolated mode in agent, Dockerfile.isolated per task, ~350 LOC across 8 files. Key insight: filesystem isolation (not tool blocking) forces MCP usage naturally.

title: Rerun remaining SG_full tasks after token refresh
description:
Tokens expired during SG_full reruns. After running python3 scripts/headless_login.py --all-accounts, rerun:
1. K8s Docs SG_full: ALL 5 tasks (never successfully ran)
2. SWE-bench Pro SG_full: 10 AgentSetupTimeoutError tasks (3 NodeBB, 4 protonmail, 2 navidrome, 1 openlibrary) + 1 zero-token (ansible-b2a289)
3. RepoQA SG_full: 1 task (cpp-skypjack-uvw-00)

Use --full-only flag with 3config scripts. Run when system load is low (<5) to avoid AgentSetupTimeoutError. K8s and SWE-Pro NodeBB/protonmail tasks are particularly susceptible to setup timeouts.

After reruns complete, regenerate MANIFEST and close kph.

title: CodeReview verifier brittle: rejects equivalent C# null check
description: cr-aspnetcore-001 test.sh line 133 checks for literal 'For is null' but rejects equivalent 'For == null' (which ValidationMessage.cs line 49 in the same codebase uses). SG_base agent correctly fixed the defect using codebase conventions but scored 0 on that check. Fix: accept both patterns.
close_reason: Fixed: cr-aspnetcore-001 test.sh now accepts both 'For is null' and 'For == null' for defect-2 check

title: Strengthen MCP preamble: mandatory tool usage before code changes
close_reason: Strengthened MCP preamble with mandatory search-before-code workflow at 3 levels: CLAUDE.md (Two-Phase Workflow), instruction preamble (3+ search calls before any code), system prompt (concrete search requirement). Addresses 11/112 zero-MCP-usage tasks. Committed to evals repo (775c3d8).

title: Run investigation tasks across 3 configs and analyze SG value delta
description: Once ccb_investigation tasks are scaffolded: (1) Run baseline (no SG tools), SG_base, and SG_full configs. (2) Measure per-task rewards and compare. (3) Analyze SG tool usage in transcripts — which SG-unique tools were used, how they contributed to task success. (4) Calculate the SG value delta specifically for tasks that REQUIRE cross-repo/commit-level tools. (5) Generate a comparison report showing genuine SG value on investigation tasks vs the near-zero delta on standard tasks. This is the key deliverable for demonstrating MCP value.
close_reason: Ran all 4 investigation tasks across 3 configs × 2 models (Opus+Haiku). Opus SG_base avg +0.02 (1.00 on K8s). Haiku SG_base avg -0.22 (MCP hurts weaker models). Fixed cost extraction bug (95% overestimate). Created investigation_3config.sh.

title: Design blind-bug task variants — vague instructions requiring discovery
description: For 5-10 existing SWE-bench Pro tasks, create instruction variants where the bug location is NOT given. Current instructions often point to specific files/functions. Variants use realistic user-reported symptoms: e.g., 'Fix NULL handling in album.go' becomes 'Users report albums occasionally fail to load. Investigate and fix.' Same verifier, same Dockerfile, different instruction.md. SG semantic search genuinely helps with discovery when the agent doesn't know WHERE to look. Implementation: create instruction_blind.md variants, add --instruction-variant flag to agent, compare baseline vs SG on discovery success rate. Select tasks where the original instruction reveals the bug location.
close_reason: Design complete: docs/DESIGN_blind_bug_variants.md. Phase 1 MVP: 3 HIGH-rated tasks (qutebrowser CertificateErrorWrapper, element-web VoiceBroadcastLiveness, openlibrary WorkSearchScheme). Env var INSTRUCTION_VARIANT=blind selects instruction_blind.md. ~400 LOC across 6-8 files. Key metric: (B-A)-(Y-X) measures MCP discovery value.

title: Scaffold ccb_investigation tasks — regression hunt, impact analysis, cross-service debug, migration audit
description: Implement 3-4 prototype investigation tasks using existing SG-indexed repos. Each task needs: task.toml, instruction.md, Dockerfile, tests/test.sh. Task designs: (a) Regression Hunt using flipt or ansible repo — 'users report X broke, find the commit and fix', requires commit_search + diff_search. (b) Impact Analysis using kubernetes — 'change function Foo signature, find and update all callers', requires find_references cross-repo. (c) Cross-Service Debug — 'Service A fails calling Service B, diagnose contract mismatch', requires multi-repo search with only Service A in workspace. (d) Migration Discovery — 'library X deprecated API Y, find all usages across org', requires org-wide keyword_search. Blocked by design task.
close_reason: Scaffolded 4 investigation tasks: inv-regression-001 (Grafana v38 migration), inv-impact-001 (K8s DRA AllocationMode), inv-debug-001 (Prometheus remote-write resharding), inv-migration-001 (Django ADMINS/MANAGERS). Each has task.toml, instruction.md, Dockerfile, test.sh, ground_truth.json. All commits verified in SG.

title: Investigate baseline token logging bug (52 runs report 0 tokens)
description: QA audit H3: 52 baseline runs report 0 tokens despite valid execution and results. May be a Harbor issue or Claude Code CLI issue. Need to determine if this affects cost reporting and whether reruns are needed.
close_reason: Root cause identified: Harbor's _get_session_dir fails when Claude Code spawns subagents (Task tool), creating subagents/ subdir that confuses multi-dir detection. Affects 18 runs across 7 benchmarks. Scoring NOT affected (rewards are correct). Cost data recoverable from claude-code.txt transcripts. No reruns needed. Optional Harbor upstream fix to prefer top-level session dir over subagent dirs.

title: Pin TAC OpenHands sg-benchmarks mirror to specific commit
description: TAC tasks tac-write-unit-test and tac-dependency-change use sg-benchmarks/OpenHands--latest mirror which is NOT pinned to a specific commit. The TAC GitLab commit bfd78f9 was not found in upstream GitHub repo. Risk: SG searches different code than local Docker env. Either fork at the GitLab commit or document the limitation. See docs/INSTRUCTION_RUN_AUDIT_2026-02-06.md issue P-1.
close_reason: Confirmed bfd78f9 does not exist in upstream All-Hands-AI/OpenHands GitHub repo. This is a TAC GitLab-only commit from pre-built Docker images. Cannot pin mirror — --latest fallback is the best option. Already documented in instance_to_mirror.json with commit=null and explicit notes. These 2 tasks (tac-write-unit-test, tac-dependency-change) should be flagged in evaluation report as having potential SG code divergence.

title: TAC requires live infrastructure for reruns
description: TAC benchmark tasks require RocketChat (find-in-codebase-1/2) and OpenHands+TAC server (dependency-change, write-unit-test). All 6 tasks score 0.0 because infrastructure is unreachable. Need to either spin up TAC server or exclude TAC from leaderboard results. buffer-pool-manager and implement-hyperloglog are genuine coding tasks that don't need infra but are genuinely hard.
close_reason: TAC infra (RocketChat + GitLab) confirmed working. All 3 configs completed. find-in-codebase tasks score 0.0 but verifier runs correctly.

close_reason: Added chmod -R 777 /app/project to LoCoBench template Dockerfile, adapter.py _generate_dockerfile(), and all 50 generated task Dockerfiles. Agents can now write to /app/project/ for code modification tasks.

title: TAC score extraction bug: hidden successes reported as 0
description: TAC test.sh score extraction silently fails, causing python_default fallback to report 0. Real scores: implement-hyperloglog=1.0 (PERFECT), buffer-pool-manager=0.667, write-unit-test=0.2. Also SG_base batch used --output_path instead of --result_path. Fix test.sh score extraction and rerun all TAC tasks.
close_reason: Fixed: replaced python_default -c with python3 -c for score extraction in all 8 TAC test.sh files, and swapped final_score/score check priority

title: US-001: Diagnose SWE-bench Pro Docker failures by error group
close_reason: Completed. 42 infra failures diagnosed: 25 rate-limit, 10 Node.js version (protonmail), 4 timeout, 3 corruption. See docs/swebenchpro_docker_diagnosis.md

title: Resolve 4 duplicate runs with divergent rewards
description: QA audit C7: 4 tasks have duplicate runs with different rewards (qutebrowser, tutanota). Establish policy (keep latest? keep best?) and archive the duplicates. Currently MANIFEST uses latest-wins which may not always be correct.
close_reason: Resolved: 23 divergent duplicate pairs traced to 2 root causes. (1) PyTorch gapfill batch used old broken verifier — archived, main batch has correct results. (2) SWE-Perf old batch already archived. (3) Remaining duplicates (qutebrowser, LargeRepo) are genuine non-determinism — latest-wins MANIFEST policy is appropriate.

title: Run CodeReview benchmark: 3 tasks x 3 configs
description: Execute first runs for CodeReview benchmark. 3 tasks (cr-ghost-001, cr-aspnetcore-001, cr-calcom-001) across baseline, sourcegraph_base, sourcegraph_full. Config script exists: configs/codereview_3config.sh. Verify Docker builds succeed first with a quick single-task test.
notes: Baseline: 3/3 done (1.0, 1.0, 0.8). MCP-base launched (sg-benchmarks mirrors). MCP-full will auto-launch after base. Invalid MCP runs archived.
close_reason: CodeReview 3x3 complete. Baseline avg=0.93, SG_base avg=0.89, SG_full avg=0.93. Results in codereview_opus_20260206_155036 (baseline), codereview_opus_20260206_163958 (SG_base), codereview_opus_20260206_164838 (SG_full).
